title: Schick Owner Buys Women’s Razor Brand Billie for $310 Million
sub_head: The Federal Trade Commission had blocked a deal for Gillette parent Procter & Gamble to acquire the startup
body:
The maker of Schick razors has acquired women’s razor maker Billie Inc., after federal antitrust regulators scuttled an attempt by rival Procter & Gamble Co. to buy the online startup, according to people familiar with the deal.
Edgewell Personal Care Co. will pay $310 million for Billie and plans to start selling the brand, which also sells body lotion, lip balm and other personal care products, in physical stores this winter, the people said. Billie’s annual revenue is around $90 million, they said.
